summary: Current water quality metrics are within acceptable ranges but show slight deviations from recent averages.

insights.recommendation: Monitor pH closely; consider adding buffers if it drops below 6.8.
Check for any sources of contamination; consider partial water changes if TDS exceeds 400 ppm.
Ensure temperature remains stable; avoid sudden drops below 22°C.

extended_notes:
Last 7 days overview:
• pH avg/min/max: 7.041 / 7.018 / 7.08 (trend: down)
• TDS avg/min/max: 311.782 / 295.1 / 347.6 ppm (trend: down)
• Temp avg/min/max: 27.555 / 24.62 / 30.06 °C (trend: down)

Actions (if needed):
• pH: keep ~6.6–7.2; calibrate probe with 7.00/4.01; adjust slowly.
• TDS: seedlings ~200–500 ppm; higher OK for mature plants; water-change to reduce.
• Temp: hold in target band for your fish/plants; heater/chiller/aeration as needed.
